info.title: Okto Trade Service
info.description: Okto Trade Service describes the APIs for the trade service. It provides endpoints for fetching quotes, best routes, registering intents, and retrieving order details.

post.description: Returns a quote for the specified token pair and amount.

message.example: The provided token address is invalid.

post.description: Finds the most optimal route for the swap.

message.example: The provided token address is invalid.

post.description: Registers a swap intent within the system.
Fetches the details of an intent using the order ID.
Provides the calldata required to execute the transaction.

message.example: The provided token address is invalid.

xAuthorizationSecret.name: x-authorization-secret
xAuthorizationSecret.description: Trade Service Secret (set this to the value of TRADE_SERVICE_SECRET from .env)

id_token.name: id_token
id_token.description: The id_token of the user received from the Google OAuth2 provider.

order_id.name: order_id
order_id.description: The order ID to get the specific order details.

order_id_txn.name: order_id
order_id_txn.description: Order ID of the transaction to check.

order_state.name: order_state
order_state.description: The order state to filter the orders. Possible values are PENDING, SUCCESS, FAILED.

token_address.name: token_address
token_address.description: Address of the token to be transferred.

transaction_EVM.name: transaction_EVM
transaction_EVM.description: Execute raw transactions (EVM). Use this transaction object if "network_name" is any "BASE", "POLYGON" or "POLYGON_TESTNET_AMOY".

from.description: The address for the sending account.

to.description: The destination address of the message, left undefined for a contract-creation transaction.

data.description: Either a ABI byte string containing the data of the function call on a contract, or in the case of a contract-creation transaction the initialisation code.

value.description: The value transferred for the transaction in wei, also the endowment if it's a contract-creation transaction.

transaction_SOL.name: transaction_SOL
transaction_SOL.description: Execute raw transactions (Solana). Use this transaction object if "network_name" is "SOLANA" or "SOLANA_DEVNET".

keys.description: Includes the AccountMeta for each account required by an instruction.

programId.description: The address of the program which contains the execution logic for the instruction invoked.

data.description: The instruction data for the instruction as a buffer of bytes

transaction_APT.name: transaction_APT
transaction_APT.description: Execute raw transactions (Aptos). Use this transaction object if "network_name" is "APTOS" or "APTOS_TESTNET".

function.description: This is the identifier for the smart contract entry function on-chain that will trigger when you execute this transaction.

typeArugements.description: Data type for each function arguement in the same order.

fuctionArugements.description: This is any data the function needs to run.

quantity.name: quantity
quantity.description: Quantity of tokens to be transferred.

nft_address.name: nft_address
nft_address.description: Address of the nft which needs to be transferred.

operation_type.name: operation_type
operation_type.description: Type of operation to be performed.

collection_address.name: collection_address
collection_address.description: Address of the collection which needs to be transferred.

collection_name.name: collection_name
collection_name.description: Name of the collection which needs to be transferred.

recipient_address.name: recipient_address
recipient_address.description: Address of the recipient address to send tokens to.

vendor_jwt.name: Authorization
vendor_jwt.description: Vendor's JWT that needs to be verified for the user authentication

refresh_auth.name: x-refresh-authorization
refresh_auth.description: Current refresh token with Bearer prefix

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The number of items to return

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The number of items to skip
